title: The Humble advice, and tender declaration, or remonstrance of several thousands of men fearing God, in the county of Durham, Northumberland, and the adjacent parts of Westmerland and Cumberland, with the north part of Yorkshire; to the Lord General Monk and those vvith him.
publisher: Printed by Henry Hills, dwelling next door to the Peacock in Aldersgate street.,
notes: Signed: Your friends, so far as you are friends to God and the good old cause.
In ms. at foot of page: Octob: M DC LIX.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
